comments.body:
Nitpick: we format the comments as

```
/** A marker CompilationUnit to return up the call stack from ReadTasty.  This will tell us that we've
 *  encountered, and attempted to inspect, a Java class file.  We can't TASTy-inspect a Java class obviously,
 *  but we want to return the fact we found it so that higher-up we can take appropriate action if desired.
 */
```
This is good feedback.  Will work on these changes--and the comments.

A question:  A "normal" CompilationUnit does not currently store the full class name.  The JavaCompilationUnit and Scala2CompilationUnit flavors do.  What should compilationUnitClassname() return for a Scala3/Tasty CompilationUnit?  Some options:
1) Return "" for normal CU
2) Make compilationUnitClassname() return Option[String]

Any preferences?

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +7,11 @@ *  encountered, and attempted to inspect, a Java class file.  We can't TASTy-inspect a Java class obviously,
 *  but we want to return the fact we found it so that higher-up we can take appropriate action if desired.
 */
class JavaCompilationUnit(val className: String) extends CompilationUnit(NoSource) {
  override def toString: String = s"Java class file $className"
